intro: Pterostigma stricta, commonly known as the narrow-winged pterostigma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pterostigma stricta is relatively uncommon and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
